metadata.title: 5440-1 -- PostgreSQL vulnerability
metadata.description: Alexander Lakhin discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled the security restricted operation sandbox when a privileged user is maintaining another user's objects. An attacker having permission to create non-temp objects can use this issue to execute arbitrary commands as the superuser.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo ua fix USN-5440-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  postgresql-server-dev-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libecpg6 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libpq-dev - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 postgresql-pltcl-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libpgtypes3 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 postgresql-plperl-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 postgresql-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libecpg-dev - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 postgresql-plpython3-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libpq5 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 postgresql-doc-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 postgresql-client-13 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 libecpg-compat3 - 13.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1 No subscription required
